episode_summary: This episode covers a range of quirky and intriguing facts, including Genoa Airport's unique pesto policy, a study questioning the Beatles' influence on music, the peculiar items brought by pilgrims on the Mayflower, and a scientific paper on horse evolution by someone aptly named MacHorse.

facts.fact: Genoa Airport has relaxed its liquid ban, but only for pesto.
It has been scientifically proven that the Beatles were an average band who didn't really influence music.
When the first pilgrims went over on the Mayflower, one of them brought 139 pairs of shoes with him.
A new scientific paper on why horses only have one toe has been published; the author of that paper is called Brianna MacHorse.
